paragraphs.text: Will you not give over, Basil, packing this sacred haunt of the Muses with Cappadocians, and these redolent of the frost[fn-65-P6559_1966854:1-nf] and snow and all Cappadocia's good things? They have almost made me a Cappadocian too, always chanting their "I salute you."

references.text: grith/, an unknown word. Perhaps akin to krioth. cf. Duncange s.v.

paragraphs.text: I must endure, since it is Basil who commands. Know, however, that I am making a careful study of the manners and customs of the country, anti that I mean to metamorphose the men into the nobility and the harmony of my Calliope, that they may seem to you to be turned from pigeons into doves.
